activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah L Hattix

10:40 AM Defendant Elijah L Hattix in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
SPD has not appointed counsel as of this date.
BTC: Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all.

1:59 PM Defendant Elijah L Hattix appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Elijah L Hattix.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
